abstract: I’d seen this before: These people knew how to build a product, but they did not know how to build a company.
snippet: I’d seen this before: These people knew how to build a product, but they did not know how to build a company.
lead_paragraph: It was almost 30 years ago that I led a management buyout of what was then a failing International Harvester factory in Springfield, Mo. As it is now, the economy then was in the tank and capital was next to impossible to come by. I was convinced that our only hope was to open the books and teach every employee how to think like an owner. As I explained in my first post, things have worked out pretty well for the company we created, SRC Holdings.

headline.main: Starting Over at a Lexington Manufacturing Plant
